messages.title: It’s time for change.
messages.content: The Prime Minister has now named the date for the General Election as Thursday 6th May 2010 – and I am very proud and honoured to have accepted the Conservative nomination to be Hammersmith's next Member of Parliament.

mentions.tacticalSituation: This election will be between Conservatives and Labour - the Lib Dems always come a poor third here and are spending all their time campaigning in Brent.

issues.economy: Britain needs change in order to act on debt and get our economy moving
issues.socialWelfare: make Britain the most family friendly country in Europe; change our broken politics.

leaflet.personalStatement: I grew up in and around Hammersmith and my family still live here. It's a great part of London, but we face several challenges. Together, we can make it even better.

politicalExperience.achievements: Over the past three years I have worked hard to campaign on local issues – such as opposing Labour's third runway at Heathrow, which would bring a plane overhead every 90 seconds, working with residents to stop a lap-dancing club opening in residential Avonmore and also against Labour's closure of local Post Offices.

contactInformation.address: Shaun Bailey Campaign, 4 Greyhound Road, London W6 8NX

images.caption: Conservative Candidate for Hammersmith & Shepherds Bush

leaflet.additionalNotes: The choice at this election is either five more years of Gordon Brown or a new Conservative Government under David Cameron to bring the change we need.
